Event.name: Go_into_shape
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Theme</fen>, which may or may not have a default shape or configuration, goes into a particular shape without being made to do so by an agent. Depending on the type of shape, there may be a Locus about which the <fen>Theme</fen> changes shape.
<ex><fex name="Theme">It</fex> <t>curled</t> up <fex name="Resultant_configuration">into a cylinder</fex> <fex name="Circumstances">after laying in the sun</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fex name="Explanation">Explanation</fex> for which the change into the shape occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>When the changing into a particular shape occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the shape-changing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), force (<ment>hard, softly</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>).
</def-root>

Arg.name: Resultant_configuration
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> is the shape the <fen>Theme</fen> becomes.
<ex><fex name="Theme">It</fex> <t>folded</t> <fex name="Resultant_configuration">into a ball</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The conditions under which the <fen>Theme</fen> is shaped.
<ex>The leaf <t>folded</t> <fex name="Circumstances">in the sun</fex> <fex name="Explanation">because the heat evaporated much of its water content</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Imposed_purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The state of the <fen>Theme</fen> with respect to the change brought about by making the adjustment.
<ex>The contraption <t>folds</t> <fex name="imp">to fit in the bag</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: coil.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: go into a coiled configuration.

lexUnit.name: fold.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to bend or change shape

lexUnit.name: fold [protein].v
lexUnit.definition: FN: undergo the physical process by which a polypeptide changes shape to yield its characteristic and functional three-dimensional structure from a random coil.
